newsitem.title: USA: Sears sees $100-$150 mln rise in '97 earnings.
newsitem.headline: Sears sees $100-$150 mln rise in '97 earnings.

text.p: Sears, Roebuck & Co said on Tuesday it anticipates an increase of appproximately $100 to $150 million in 1997 earnings due to the recognition of gains on receivables expected to be sold after December 28, 1996.
Sears made the disclosure in a brief filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
It said the accounting recognition is called for under Financial Accounting Standard Board rule No. 125, which requires Sears to recognize a gain on securitizations that qualify as sales.

The rule, known as Financial Accounting Standard (SFAS) provides U.S. corporations with guidance for distinguishing transfers of financial assets or securitizations that are sales, from transfers that are secured borrowings and is effective for securitizations occuring after December 28, 1996, the last day of Sears' fiscal year, it said.
